comments:
Build ID: 3.3 RC4
CDT: 4.0.0-I200706200100

I reinstalled Eclipse together with CDT from scratch and created also a new
workspace. Now I got during the indexing many (at least 30) identical
exceptions at once.

I haven't seen this with 3.3 RC3/4.0 RC3. But this time I opened all C++ views
and got before another error (#139882, comment #6). After this the DOM AST
view is empty and doesn't show anything. That's why I think it complains with:

Unhandled event loop exception

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)

Is there any more to the log? The info after:

    Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

would tell us where the NPE was.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Is there any more to the log? The info after:
> 
>     Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
> 
> would tell us where the NPE was.

Of course! But please note that I copied the text from the Error Log View.
If it doesn't display all necessary information you should fix it as well, right? 

Please see Comment #4 of bug #193505 for my full logs.

(I really wonder about the current state of CDT, RC3 was very, very stable, only two or three exceptions where remaining which were already fixed in HEAD. I tried HEAD and now I got hundreds of exceptions!)

(In reply to comment #2)
> Of course! But please note that I copied the text from the Error Log View.
> If it doesn't display all necessary information you should fix it as well,
> right? 

Unfortunately, I don't have write permission to the source code of the logging code.
I think this is likely a limitation in the specific release of the JVM you're using e.g. http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4292742

(In reply to comment #4)
> I think this is likely a limitation in the specific release of the JVM you're
> using e.g. http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4292742

Do you really think the bug servived up to 1.6.0_01 (x86_64)? That's the
newest version!

Nevertheless the reason for this bug is probably explained in bug 193505.

Not strictly a duplicate of 193505, but same root cause.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 193505 ***
